That done, let us bury in oblivion the horrors of that shameful tumult; and may no other army hear" those dreadful imprecations uttered" against a Roman senate! Against that" venerable body, the head of the empire," and ithe fountain, from which justice" flows through the provinces, not even" Vitellius, nor his rash-levied crew of" Germans, would dare to meditate so" vile a deed." And can there be in Italy a race of" men, the genuine offspring of Roman" citizens, who are capable of so foul a par*" ricide? who can lift their impious hands" against the sacred order, from whom" our cause derives so much lustre, to the" confusion of Vitellius and the scum of" nations that follows him to the field?" Some states, it is true, have been in-*' duced to join his standard; he has the" appearance of an army; but the senate** is on our side. The commonwealth is*' with us; our enemies are the enemies" of Rome. And when I mention Rome,
